name: CustomToken
description: Custom Token implementation note: debug messages in `require` calls could be omitted, but are kept for clarity even if their storage uses more gas.

eventDecorators.name: Price
eventDecorators.description: Emitted when a token is locked or the lock on a token is extended.

eventDecorators.name: Purchase
eventDecorators.description: Emitted when a token is locked or the lock on a token is extended.

eventDecorators.name: Sell
eventDecorators.description: Emitted when a token is locked or the lock on a token is extended.

eventDecorators.name: Transfer
eventDecorators.description: Emitted when a token is locked or the lock on a token is extended.

functionDecorators.name: buyToken
functionDecorators.description: a function via which a user purchases `amount` number of tokens by paying the equivalent price in wei; if the purchase is successful, the function returns a boolean value (true) and emits an event Purchase with the buyer's address and the purchased amount.

parameterDecorators.name: amount
parameterDecorators.description: The number of tokens to purchase.

functionDecorators.name: calcPrice
functionDecorators.description: a view to calculate the price to pay for buying `amount` tokens at the current token price.

functionDecorators.name: changePrice
functionDecorators.description: a function via which the contract's creator can change the tokenPrice; if the action is successful, the function returns a boolean value (true) and emits an event Price with the new price.

functionDecorators.name: close
functionDecorators.description: destroy the contract https://medium.com/better-programming/solidity-what-happens-with-selfdestruct-f337fcaa58a7 https://ethereum.stackexchange.com/a/347 > For example, calling `selfdestruct(address)` sends > all of the contract's current balance to `address`.

functionDecorators.name: getBalance
functionDecorators.description: a view that returns the amount of tokens that the user owns.

returnDecorators.description: Returns the number of tokens that the user owns.

functionDecorators.name: sellToken
functionDecorators.description: a function via which a user sells amount number of tokens and receives from the contract tokenPrice wei for each sold token; if the sell is successful, the sold tokens are destroyed, the function returns a boolean value (true) and emits an event Sell with the seller's address and the sold amount of tokens.

functionDecorators.name: transfer
functionDecorators.description: a function that transfers amount number of tokens from the account of the transaction's sender to the recipient; if the transfer is successful, the function returns a boolean value (true) and emits an event Transfer, with the sender's and receiver's addresses and the transferred amount >> Note: it's possible to transfer your own tokens to yourself. *Why* you would want to do that is a different question.

functionDecorators.name: withdrawETHBalance
functionDecorators.description: allows a user to withdraw their ETH balance in the contract (after selling their tokens).
